page.title: 11Dunford's Garden Centre.
page.content: As we went there we went through Chapel Park. When we got there we saw grow bags and fancy flower pots, mushroom bags and pepper plants. The price of the pepper plants was 49 pence each. There were some things for cats and dogs, toys and pet food. There was garden furniture. What I liked best was the walk there. At the garden centre we saw some sheds and greenhouses. A shed is made of wood and a greenhouse is made of glass. A greenhouse has a frame for the glass. You can grow lettuce in a greenhouse and also tomatoes. When we went to the garden centre, we saw flowers and garden gnomes. There were bird tables. There were two fountains and I threw 2 pence in and I made a wish.
